content: The examination control system manages all aspects of academic examinations including scheduling, student registration, paper distribution, and result processing.
title: System Overview

content: Examination scheduling requires coordination between departments, faculty availability, and room capacity. The system automatically resolves conflicts and optimizes resource allocation.
title: Exam Scheduling

content: Students can register for examinations through the online portal within the designated registration period. Late registration may incur additional fees.
title: Student Registration

content: Examination papers are prepared by faculty members and must be submitted to the examination office at least two weeks before the exam date. Papers are stored securely.
title: Paper Management

content: Results are processed within 10 working days after the examination. Students can view their results online and request rechecking if needed.
title: Results Processing
